mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: Does for "E.T." what "Super 8" did for "Close Encounters." As lovably '80s as Reece's Pieces and pop socks.
Despite the shaky-cam aesthetic, Dave Green’s first feature still makes for a brisk, appealing adventure capably anchored by four young actors.
An exceptionally fine children's film.

Green and his cast deliver a wonderful surprise. Echo himself, a generically precious alien, is the least of it. The funny, moving, authentic bond among the kids in the movie is the unadvertised draw.
Earth to Echo is about adventure, bravery and excitement, but mostly it's about friendship— a subject that resonates with audiences of all ages.
It’s not exceedingly original, it is well-made and a solid entry into the subgenre.
The filmmakers wanted to broaden the formula a little, make it more inclusive, do something a little adventurous. Kinda like Earth to Echo's tween heroes.

Attractively made, good-hearted, and more than a little redundant even as it's trying a little too hard, Earth to Echo nonetheless will hit the sweet spot for parents looking for innocent PG-rated entertainment for their kids in a summer full of PG-13 spectacle and mayhem.

Credit a youthful, energetic spirit, nicely conveyed by its cast of naturally-acting newcomers, a workable raw-footage construct and a spare but smartly spent special effects budget for the satisfying end result.
Earth To Echo is a little bit big and broad, but that's also part of its charm.

Would that the movie had gone the next step, and possibly imagined that this bright, shiny little E.T. had figured out how to get kids to do its sinister work for him by providing free WiFi and endless smartphone upgrades in exchange for undying loyalty, we might have had something altogether different on our hands.
Yes, it’s plainly derivative, but Dave Green’s debut feature is heartfelt and fun, particularly for children craving live-action films beyond big-budget superhero reboots and animated sequels.
The saving grace for this film is the group of young actors.
An 'E.T.' knockoff that works.
Earth to Echo resonates, despite itself.

It's no "E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial." (What is?) But on its own modest terms, the alien adventure Earth to Echo is a lively and likable knockoff that should divert, if not exactly enthrall, tweens and young teens.
Despite its adoption of that trendy (and more than a little tired) shooting style, there's an old-fashioned charm to Earth to Echo.

The most derivative movie of the summer, Earth To Echo, is also the most visually unpredictable, chock-full of degraded digital textures that seem ready to boil off the screen, picture-boxed within Mac desktops and overlaid with extraterrestrial interface trees.
All in all, Earth to Echo is passable family entertainment, neither unforgettable nor particularly bad.
The found-footage approach loses its shine quickly.

What ultimately should have been borrowed from Spielberg’s oeuvre but isn’t is a sense of wonder and achievement whenever characters come in contact with the unknown or overcome a great obstacle as a team. Imitation should be flattering, not flattening.
This isn't a family-friendly film - anyone over the age of about 8 will immediately recognize that significant chunks of the story don't make sense.
The constant foregrounding of so much well-executed incident only works to shortchange the heroes' yearnings and anxieties.
It's not particularly logical and it's not particularly fun. As deliberately amateur as the herky-jerky photography is, the rest of the film isn't much more professional.

Earth to Echo is a slender kiddie flick about a quartet of preteens and their palm-sized alien pal that's at once bland, well-intentioned, and utterly terrifying about the mental development of modern children.

Technology remains no substitute for well-written characters and genuine intrigue and atmosphere, so despite the cute special effects and camera jostling, this film feels like an extended episode of an after-school show by Disney.

Earth to Echo is a copy of a copy. The movie feels less like a weak “E.T.” than a substandard “Mac and Me.” And you may not even remember the latter, a 1988 flop — the fate likely to hit this well-meaning but underwhelming effort.
Earth To Echo is yet another found-footage film, and not a particularly inventive one at that.
Earth to Echo reaches for the stars with its gentle sci-fi shenanigans, but the rote result remains decidedly earthbound.
It's as if there's a barrier between the viewer and the story that never comes down.
Even at a cramped and frenetic 82 minutes, the movie feels long. That’s what happens when the audience can guess everything that’s going to happen in advance.

mc_user_reviews.text: what's there to say about 'Earth to Echo'? well it's a little found footage family movie about a bunch of kids who find a little alien and named it Echo. so now, these kids are gonna try to get it back home. yeah, it's a pretty obvious rip-off of 'E.T'. the kids in the movie, they were okay but a few of them were actually good. and the kids are supposed to form this bond with the alien, but in the end i was like "Are you really bonding with it?" cause i wasn't bonding with it either. i mean sure, the alien's really cute and stuff, but that doesn't really mean much. the biggest problem with 'Earth to Echo' is that it's trying to be a throwback to the 80's movies like 'The Goonies' and of course 'E.T', these kid movies we grew up on. what they do wrong is what they did wrong in this movie. the fact is: the kids in the movie don't act like kids. these are kids in junior high with no parents around whatsoever. but they never act like actual kids in this movie and that felt really weird and stupid. have the kids act human, have them use swear words like in 'E.T', ya know like normal funny human stuff. directors these days don't really do it, cause they don't wanna push it like "No, we gotta keep it PG". this is a PG-rated movie and you can tell, cause the kids just talk but none of them actually gets to curse. one of them says "balls" once but that's it. it felt like the movie was written by people who don't have kids. so is 'Earth to Echo' that movie of this generation? no, not really. it's just your average found footage movie with the same kinda built up that's actually pretty boring, and it's nothing new. just the same found footage stuff all over again. maybe young kids - like 5 or 6 year olds - might like and enjoy the movie. but this movie was made for the junior or middle school kids, and even they might get bored outta their minds. so in the end, it had a few decent moments with cool special effects, and the alien was adorable, but that's not saying much. 'Earth to Echo' was more of a snooze fest rather than a entertaining movie.

Why they made this movie ,the cover is the same as E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial , the movie is not original it is another stupid remake , now in this movie we have the owl from Clash of the Titans (1981)

Who remembers ,Mac and Me (1988)  i like more that crap than Earth to Echo , this movie is so dumb as Mac and Me , today watching the movies of  the goonies .stand by me. explorers, they are better movies , Earth to Echo is gonna happened the same as Mac and Me (1988) Forgotten

PLEASE let this be the LAST one!! ,I beg you hollywood  this movie is so horrible ,  i didn't have fun watching this movie , i went to the theaters and i was so bored of Earth to Echo,  it is the same old story we seen in other movies.
i didn't like this movie ,it is badly done,  and i there so many kind of movies like this and they are much better movies , E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial and the Goonies and Super 8
how much the movie borrows from Spielberg and others, but kids likely won't catch any of it--and likely won't care, i prefer watching Tammy (2014) than this remake movie.

Transformers: Age of Extinction (2014) is very good movie but it is better than Earth to Echo (2014), this movie is a remake of Super 8 and Chronicle (2012),  There are more remakes than original movies.
I can tell they won't have the same spark that the kids from the others classic kids movies had. You can also tell that the kids acting are be bad ,the truth is this movie is crappy.

Earth to Echo incorporates movies like Cloverfield, Super 8 and E.T., and does each of those movies justice. I found it to be enjoyable, sincere and at the same time highlighting an important theme, friendship.
Wow this movie is bad ,  i prefer seeing Transformers 4 again , I stay with the classic kids movies, from the 80's  ,So much stuff in this movie is ripped right out of other movies.

Hollywood is running out of ideas ,first they remake all the good horror movies of the 80's and the 70's ,and know they made, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2014) and Earth to Echo is a copy of many movies ,What's next  The Incredible Hulk on bike
First, the script is dumb. and Earth to Echo doesn't live up to - films like "Super 8" and "Stand By Me or The Goonies . Earth to Echo is the worst summer movie i seen in first of july
Elliott! Elliott!, Phone Home. i like Earth to Echo,  but is not good as the others kids movies of the 80's ,and  the Super 8 is better. E.T.! E.T.! E.T.! Be good.

the movie is a waste of time, Echo more closely resembles, this film doesn't maintain a consistent point of view or any logic about what's on screen , Spielberg's E.T., so ugly it was cute, was also full of personality. Echo is adorable and forgettable, and the rest of the characters are simply plot holders in a narrative contraption that generates jeopardy-raising obstacles to Echo going home.
This is a copy of Super 8 (2011) and Chronicle (2012) and what is Optimus Prime and the owl of Clash of the Titans  (1981) doing in this movie ? ,This looks like a remake movie
Pretty much.Take out everything that made from , super 8 . The Goonies .E.T.  The Monster Squad. Stand by Me . Chronicle . in my opinion  Earth to Echo is the big remake movie  that Hollywood done

This movie will have you praying for death. So bad in so many ways; my mind is overloaded with how tragic this film is. I would say it looks like a bad elementary-school iMovie project but I don't know any kids this dumb. Just unbelievably bad; do not waste your time or money putting these sadly unremovable images into your brain.

This was the best movie ever. I saw the bad reviews and thought it would be boring, but when I saw it I literally said and thought to everybody around me, "who could think this is boring?" This was the bets movie of all time, and I like it better than even Disney, and I am a Disney fan. No chance I'm ever going to see a better movie. I loved Earth to Echo, brilliant movie!!!

You may hate me for this, but hear me out. I am one who does not watch nearly any "alien" movies but I found this one to be perfect in many ways. Combining the phone cameras with the special effects was perfect. Earth to echo is not a bad movie.

Beware if you get motion sickness easy. My wife, and I, and one of our daughters almost had to leave the film because of how jerky the filming was.I understand the way the movie was made, but it was horrible in that respect, very nauseating. The movie in itself was actually pretty decent.
This movie is a great movie. A mixture of E.T Goonies and Stand by Me. DO see this! A great movie for the whole family.  If you only see one movie this summer see Earth to Echo!!!

This movie is definitely geared toward the minds of the 10-14 age range, the ones that are more open to the ideas that this movie promotes. References have been made to ET, and Super 8 but it still lacks the substance needed to make it appealing to an all age audience. The basic concept of making these boys last night memorable and the growth in thought they experience as it is happening is a positive influence. The reality aspect used for filming this movie will draw in a younger mind but leaves an older audience member needing more substance.

I was really hesitant in watching this film with all of the bad reviews, but let me tell you something NEVER LISTEN TO THEM FORM YOUR OWN OPINION. Personally I enjoyed Earth to Echo and I loved how it was filmed from a first person perspective with the use of Tuck's camera. It made it feel unique and it wasn't too shaky like Cloverfield. The film aimed to highlight the importance of friendship and how this strong bond can sometimes be stretch to it's limits in tough circumstances. It defiantly got a lot of inspiration from Steven Spielberg with E.T. and Super 8 which made the film more engaging and familiar. Overall I highly recommend Earth to Echo to anyone you won't be as disappointed as the majority of the review say!
This movie relies too much on similar works, and it is poorly executed and not entertaining in its own right. It is merely a forgettable movie with occasional good moments.

Obviously a retake on Super 8, only a little worse, and borrowing from every PG sci-fi there ever was, Earth to Echo is not as entertaining as it promises to be, and is also not as likeable as, say, E.T. was.

While trying for E.T./Goonies you get a watered down film that never allows you to get attached to the children or its alien companion.  The film just seemed rushed and never took the time to establish anyone or thing.  Overall it's just kind of average.  C+

Is it a great movie -- well that may depend on your age and how well you can handle all the cliché's and similarities to other sci-fi flicks. But other than that is it still an okay movie, and that's mostly due to the great characters, solid plot and somewhat okay actors. Yes the plot isn't original by a long shot, but it's still works in its own way. The story is somewhat unique and there are some entertaining (but also boring) moments. But it doesn't feel that exciting as what it could have been. It started a bit slow but it ascalated greatly in the second and the third act. The aspect that really stands out in Earth To Echo is the cinematography, it's unique but somewhat shaky and annoying. But is it worth watching -- I would say that's it's a 50 % chance that you would find it okay, so it's up to you. But I wouldn't take those odds.
Whilst Earth to Echo is undeniably charming, its generic ET-like narrative riddled with numerous cliches somewhat diminished its more admirable qualities.
Earth to Echo es una película que se desarrolla en un tono amigable y que fluye de una manera admirable.

Kids riding on bikes.. Find an alien in the barn. All we need is to have have the alien eat reese's pieces and you have ET ,This is a remake of ET. Super 8. Chronicle . The Goonies . Stand by Me . The Monster Squad. Attack the Block.

This movie was basically Super 8(without the violence) + E.T.The story is where 3 guys and 1 girl meet a "robot-alien" named "Echo". They go on an adventure to help it build a spaceship, and discover a conspiracy about there town and why the government doesn't want it to happen. This could be a great movie if the idea was fresh and new, but since there are many movies like it, it kills the momentum
Disappointed  I honestly don't know where to start,  This movie is such a rip-off  . Earth to Echo is
I will never betray my Goon Dock friends.

Why another remake this movie is,  The Goonies . E.T.  The Lost Boys. The Monster Squad.  Super 8. Chronicle , every year the remakes are coming strong in hollywood , read more books hollywood there are great storys out there.

There is something rotten in Denmark when I keep seeing loads of professional and user reviews that tout how great awful movies are on sites like this one and many others like it. I'm starting to wonder if movie studios are not paying people to come on sites like this to praise terrible movies like Earth to Echo. After seeing this with the wife and daughter and a bunch of her friends I felt compelled to take over the movie selection of my daughter's slumber party and show them E.T which they absolutely adored after they got past the 70/80's clothes, home furnishings and products. Let me just say when a bunch of 11 year old girls call a movie like this one crap, it is truly CRAP!

By far, this is the worst movie I have ever watched.  The constant movement of the camera was conducive to a head ache, and not a great story line.  I can only give a one rating.  I cannot believe someone would actually give this film a 10 beside the maker of this film.  I feel cheated out of my money that was paid to see this movie.  I stopped watching the movie half way through.

my family sat down to watch it as a family...i was like this is going t be boring and downed on it at first, but was i wrong, this is a grate family movie good for all ages showing the power of friendship and that no madder how far you are your friends you will still be friends! this is a 10/10 must see and i recommend bring snacks because im a fat a** :D i really don't know why this movie has so many negative ratings it was amazing and heart warming

this movie is like super 8 and e.t  the hero of this movie was tuck most of it was like super 8 that kid alex was awesome tuck was okay but there was one more but i am not talk about him this good one guy in when i seen it he cry
echo is a uniq experince. I really liked this film but, sometimes emma made me made. she was really mean to snunge and overall compeltly ruin the whole movie by me!

Earth to Echo wanted to be a "friendly-alien-lost-on-earth" movie but I didn't do a very good job. The story was boring, the characters were not played well and in all it felt like a failed remake of E.T. The story-line was pretty much the same as E.T. anyway. At no point during the movie does it immerse you and give you a sense of feeling for the character of Echo in such a way as E.T did.
as a movie with no big expectations(unlike star wars 7) it blew my expectations.The movie is creative and underrated overall.I recommend it for people who like something a little different then ET.
